results.html:
Welcome to TreeCTF!

TreeCTF is Treehacks' Capture-the-Flag Cybersecurity Competition!

What is a CTF? CTFs are a type of computer security competition that's very similar to puzzle hunts. Certain pieces of information, called "flags", are placed on servers, encrypted, hidden, or otherwise stored somewhere difficult to access. During the competition, different challenges are released which allow the participants to reverse engineer, break, hack, decrypt, and do whatever it takes to capture that flag. When a team submits this flag to a scoring page, they will get points.

Practice resources

Sample problems

Logistics: This event runs from 1pm-5pm on Saturday, Feb 17th. Only Treehacks participants are elligible. One account per team, max size 4. There will be a 30m intro-to-CTF workshop right before the competition, as well as debrief session afterwards.

We will also have Minute-to-Win-It minigames approximately every hour during TreeCTF -- look out for some fun interactive challenges!

$1000 worth of prizes!

  1. XBox (for each member of the winning teams)
  2. Amazon Dots
  3. Yubikeys + Books
